column1: LTPP Change Events with Potential of Affecting Pavement Condition Measurements
column2: Unnamed: 1

column1: This document contains a list of LTPP change events with the potential for affecting pavement condition measurements. At present, the change events are limited to manual pavement surface distress, profile (longitudinal and transverse) and deflection testing measurements, and they include data collection guidelines, equipment, and software changes. For each change event, the following information is provided: data category, change event, date, directive, change type, and description. While none of the change events are believed to have affected the LTPP pavement condition measurements, and hence performance trends, they are provided as they could potentially help explain unexpected changes in the pavement condition measurements. Most, but not all, of these change events were documented via LTPP directive, which can easily be found by going to the Operations tab of InfoPave.

column2: CHANGE_EVENT
SHRP Distress Identification Manual (DIM) for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Studies
LTPP Distress Identification Manual for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Project, SHRP-P-338
Changes to "LTPP Distress Identification Manual for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Project," SHRP-P-338
column6: Addresses minor corrections to May 1993 DIM and changes to descriptions, measurement techniques and data forms, including elimination of longitudinal WP cracking and revision of fatigue cracking description to include all cracking in WPs.

column2: Changes to "LTPP Distress Identification Manual for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Project," SHRP-P-338
column6: Addresses corrections to the May 1993 DIM as well as some changes to descriptions, measurement techniques and data forms.

column2: LTPP Manual Distress Data Collection Procedures on Portland Cement Concrete Pavements
column6: Addresses inconsistencies in the way patching material on corner breaks, punchouts and spalls are treated in the DIM.

column2: LTPP Manual Distress Data Collection Procedures on Asphalt Concrete Pavements
column6: Addresses 'reflection cracking at joints' data inconsistencies and misunderstandings in how cracking has been rated in the past.

column2: LTPP Manual Distress Data Collection Procedures on Asphalt Concrete Pavements
column6: Reviews of 'Reflection Cracking at Joints' data revealed numerous inconsistencies in way cracking has been rated in the past. To address issue, DIM was revised to NOT include reflection cracking. Test sections that had reflection cracking at joints recorded on past surveys were to be changed to 'Longitudinal Cracking' or 'Transverse Cracking'. This issue should have been resolved long ago.

column2: Distress Identification Manual for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Program
Distress Measurements on LTPP Asphalt Concrete Test Sections - Surface Defects on Preventive Maintenance Treatments
column6: Surface defects (Bleeding, Polished Aggregate and Raveling) shall not be rated on AC pavements that have received a preventive maintenance treatment covering the original pavement surface such as chip seals, slurry seals, and fog seals. ACP with surface preventive maintenance treatments that exhibit apparent surface defects should be commented on with description of defect and approximate extent. All ACP with surface preventive maintenance treatments that have 'Surface Defects' data recorded on past surveys shall be changed to  'Other' with a description of the defect and approximate extent in square meters. This issue should have been resolved long ago.

column2: Distress Identification Manual for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Program
Clarification of LTPP Manual Distress Data Collection Procedures for Edge, Fatigue and Block Cracking
column6: Addresses differences in way edge cracking and adjacent fatigue cracking on pavements with unpaved shoulders have been rated in the past.

column2: Distress Identification Manual for LTPP â€“ May 2014
Clarification of LTPP Distress Data Collection Procedures for Asphalt Concrete (ACP) Edge Cracking, Continuously Reinforced Concrete Pavements (CRCP) Transverse Cracks and Punchouts
column6: Modified moderate severity criteria description of Edge Cracking; added information on 'How to Measure' total length of CRCP transverse crack; and modified last sentence of description of Punchouts.

column2: Errata to FHWA-HRT-13-092, Distress Identification Manual, 2014
column6: Documents changes made to DIM (FHWA-HRT-13-092) in identifying spalling of joints on rigid pavements and sealant on transverse cracks for rigid and flexible pavements.

column2: Errata-Distress Identification Manual for the Long-Term Pavement Performance Program
column6: Documents changes made to descriptions for fatigue cracking on flexible pavements and new requirements for measuring transverse profile in DIM (FHWA-HRT-13-092).

column2: Updated FWD Guidelines and Software
column6: New FWD guidelines and software including FWD Manual Version 4.0, Dynatest FWDWin Software Version 1.0 and updates to FWDScan and FWDConvert software.

column2: LTPP FWD Measurements Manual 4.1 and Calibration Procedure Updates
column6: There should be no significant changes in values prior to and after directive.

column2: Modifications to LTPP FWD Test Procedures
column6: Established FWD testing procedure to be followed when established procedure cannot be met due to traffic control constraints. Focus here is on amount/locations of data collection, not the data itself.

column2: LTPP FWD reference calibration dates.
column6: Reference calibration dates only; not relative.
